pullRequest.title: fix(AbstractIntervalDataFrameCursor): binary search scan
pullRequest.bodyText: In case of multiple equal timestamps, find the first when binary searching

nodes.bodyText: we probably don't need to check that value is positive, timestamp can also be 0 and negative. Need to search for same values regardless
the getLong() arg can't be negative, there no check for it, which is what likely has caused CI to crash

logic is great, but
mid + offset

is calculated at least 3 times per loop. I hope Java would realise that and execute only once, but I would do this kind of optimisation manually

when loop goes all the way up with all values being the same the answer should be 0. Likewise if loop goes all the way down the answer should be end of column. mid is not a good outcome considering it is not mutated by the loop above.
Perhaps there is an opportunity to kill two birds with one stone and simplify loop by mutating mid ?
